items.title: Boeing to seek FAA approval to increase 737 Max production as losses narrow
items.content: Boeing's first quarter loss narrowed to $31 million in the first quarter and it burned less cash than analysts estimated.
items.contentSnippet: Boeing's first quarter loss narrowed to $31 million in the first quarter and it burned less cash than analysts estimated.

items.title: Eli Lilly sues four telehealth sites selling compounded Zepbound, Mounjaro
items.content: Eli Lilly & Co. is suing four telehealth companies selling compounded versions of Lilly's weight-loss drug Zepbound and its diabetes drug Mounjaro.
items.contentSnippet: Eli Lilly & Co. is suing four telehealth companies selling compounded versions of Lilly's weight-loss drug Zepbound and its diabetes drug Mounjaro.

items.title: FDA to phase out dyes used in Flamin' Hot Cheetos, Skittles and other snacks
items.content: The FDA is phasing out the use of petroleum-based synthetic dyes in food and drinks.
items.contentSnippet: The FDA is phasing out the use of petroleum-based synthetic dyes in food and drinks.

items.title: Auto groups lobby Trump administration against parts tariffs in rare unified message
items.content: The group – representing franchised dealers, suppliers and nearly all major automakers – say the upcoming levies could jeopardize U.S. automotive production.
items.contentSnippet: The group – representing franchised dealers, suppliers and nearly all major automakers – say the upcoming levies could jeopardize U.S. automotive production.

items.title: Warner Bros. Discovery starts Max password-sharing crackdown
items.content: Priced at $7.99 a month, the friend or family member of the primary account owner gets their own stand-alone account under the same subscription.
items.contentSnippet: Priced at $7.99 a month, the friend or family member of the primary account owner gets their own stand-alone account under the same subscription.

items.title: RTX, GE Aerospace expect more than $1 billion tariff impact
items.content: Aerospace suppliers are grappling with higher prices for parts from President Donald Trump's tariffs.
items.contentSnippet: Aerospace suppliers are grappling with higher prices for parts from President Donald Trump's tariffs.

items.title: NYC's most expensive home lists for $110 million amid market uncertainty
items.content: The four-floor listing at 111 West 57th St. spans 11,480 square feet and is being pitched as a rare collector’s item for global elites.
items.contentSnippet: The four-floor listing at 111 West 57th St. spans 11,480 square feet and is being pitched as a rare collector’s item for global elites.

items.title: Inside the $1 billion berry startup backed by Ray Dalio’s family office
items.content: Fruitist, known for its jumbo blueberries, has surpassed $400 million in annual sales and received backing from Ray Dalio's family office.
items.contentSnippet: Fruitist, known for its jumbo blueberries, has surpassed $400 million in annual sales and received backing from Ray Dalio's family office.

items.title: Tennis great Andre Agassi to play his first pro pickleball tournament with No. 1 player Waters
items.content: Tennis great Andre Agassi will make his professional debut with top player Anna Leigh Waters.
items.contentSnippet: Tennis great Andre Agassi will make his professional debut with top player Anna Leigh Waters.

items.title: Chipotle to expand to Mexico amid Trump trade war with U.S. neighbor
items.content: Chipotle is betting that Mexico's familiarity with its ingredients and appreciation for fresh food will win over consumers.
items.contentSnippet: Chipotle is betting that Mexico's familiarity with its ingredients and appreciation for fresh food will win over consumers.

items.title: More rich Americans are opening Swiss bank accounts fearing U.S. risks
items.content: Swiss banks say they have seen a surge of interest and business from high-net-worth Americans opening investment accounts in recent months.
items.contentSnippet: Swiss banks say they have seen a surge of interest and business from high-net-worth Americans opening investment accounts in recent months.

items.title: Canadian small businesses are taking Trump's tariffs personally
items.content: Canadian national pride has sparked resistance and inspired action from small businesses.
items.contentSnippet: Canadian national pride has sparked resistance and inspired action from small businesses.

items.title: Netflix posts major earnings beat as revenue grows 13% in first quarter
items.content: The report marks the first time Netflix did not disclose quarterly subscriber data, as it shifts its strategy to focus on revenue and other metrics.
items.contentSnippet: The report marks the first time Netflix did not disclose quarterly subscriber data, as it shifts its strategy to focus on revenue and other metrics.

items.title: Netflix maintained its 2025 guidance. That may not be the sign of confidence it seems
items.content: Netflix's choice not to bump guidance suggests caution despite the company predicting limited effect from macroeconomic turbulence.
items.contentSnippet: Netflix's choice not to bump guidance suggests caution despite the company predicting limited effect from macroeconomic turbulence.

items.title: Harvard's battle with the Trump administration is creating a thorny financial situation
items.content: Even for America's richest university, covering federal funding cuts is no small task.
items.contentSnippet: Even for America's richest university, covering federal funding cuts is no small task.

items.title: American Express’ wealthy cardholders are mostly untouched by tariff jitters
items.content: American Express results show that the company's wealthier customers may insulate it somewhat from concerns that tariffs and stubborn inflation have caused.
items.contentSnippet: American Express results show that the company's wealthier customers may insulate it somewhat from concerns that tariffs and stubborn inflation have caused.

items.title: Tax attorneys say IRS has become a 'zombie' as agency cuts staff and halts audits of the wealthy
items.content: With the IRS expected to lose about a third of its staff after firings and buyouts, wealthy taxpayers and attorneys are struggling to navigate the new regime.
items.contentSnippet: With the IRS expected to lose about a third of its staff after firings and buyouts, wealthy taxpayers and attorneys are struggling to navigate the new regime.

items.title: UnitedHealth's stock is plunging on higher medical costs. That may mean trouble for more insurers
items.content: The warning sign from a health-care giant seen as the insurance industry's bellwether may mean trouble for companies with Medicare Advantage plans.
items.contentSnippet: The warning sign from a health-care giant seen as the insurance industry's bellwether may mean trouble for companies with Medicare Advantage plans.

items.title: Target CEO Cornell meets with Sharpton to discuss DEI rollback as civil rights leader considers boycott
items.content: Target CEO Brian Cornell will meet with the Rev. Al Sharpton as the company contends with a slump in foot traffic after walking back some DEI initiatives.
items.contentSnippet: Target CEO Brian Cornell will meet with the Rev. Al Sharpton as the company contends with a slump in foot traffic after walking back some DEI initiatives.

items.title: Eli Lilly’s weight loss pill succeeds in first late-stage trial on diabetes patients; shares jump 14%
items.content: The results bring Eli Lilly's pill orforglipron one step closer to becoming a new, needle-free alternative in the booming weight loss and diabetes market.
items.contentSnippet: The results bring Eli Lilly's pill orforglipron one step closer to becoming a new, needle-free alternative in the booming weight loss and diabetes market.

items.title: Chinese tea chain Chagee climbs 15% in stock market debut
items.content: Chagee, a Chinese tea chain, made its U.S. public market debut on the Nasdaq as trade tensions between Washington and Beijing rise.
items.contentSnippet: Chagee, a Chinese tea chain, made its U.S. public market debut on the Nasdaq as trade tensions between Washington and Beijing rise.

items.title: Wall Street trading desks are feasting on the volatility from Trump’s global upheaval
items.content: The six biggest U.S. banks put up $16.3 billion in stock trading revenue, 33% more year over year and higher than the 2020 pandemic or the 2008 financial crisis.
items.contentSnippet: The six biggest U.S. banks put up $16.3 billion in stock trading revenue, 33% more year over year and higher than the 2020 pandemic or the 2008 financial crisis.

items.title: Nissan aims to 'max out' U.S. production plant amid Trump's tariffs
items.content: Nissan 6-million-square-foot facility in Smyrna, Tennessee, is capable of producing 640,000 vehicles a year on three shifts, Meunier said.
items.contentSnippet: Nissan 6-million-square-foot facility in Smyrna, Tennessee, is capable of producing 640,000 vehicles a year on three shifts, Meunier said.

items.title: Proposed SNAP cuts could pressure low-income shoppers — and retailers that serve them
items.content: Potential changes to the federal food assistance program could impact millions of U.S. shoppers, retailers and food and beverage companies.
items.contentSnippet: Potential changes to the federal food assistance program could impact millions of U.S. shoppers, retailers and food and beverage companies.

items.title: JPMorgan Chase sues more customers who allegedly stole cash in 'infinite money glitch'
items.content: The episode highlights the lengths JPMorgan Chase, the biggest U.S. bank by assets, will go to claw back funds it is owed and to deter future crimes.
items.contentSnippet: The episode highlights the lengths JPMorgan Chase, the biggest U.S. bank by assets, will go to claw back funds it is owed and to deter future crimes.

items.title: U.S. vehicle supply is falling amid tariff fear-buying
items.content: Supplies of new and used vehicles for sale are declining rapidly as consumers flock to stores ahead of potential price increases due to tariffs.
items.contentSnippet: Supplies of new and used vehicles for sale are declining rapidly as consumers flock to stores ahead of potential price increases due to tariffs.

items.title: Heineken initially downplayed tariffs. Now the brewer is concerned
items.content: Heineken shrugged off the threat of tariffs earlier this year, but in the company's latest earnings report, it said it's becoming increasingly cautious.
items.contentSnippet: Heineken shrugged off the threat of tariffs earlier this year, but in the company's latest earnings report, it said it's becoming increasingly cautious.

items.title: United Airlines gives two 2025 profit outlooks, calling economy 'impossible' to predict
items.content: United Airlines said a deterioration in bookings could lead it to lower its 2025 outlook to $7 to $9 a share from $11.50 to $13.50.
items.contentSnippet: United Airlines said a deterioration in bookings could lead it to lower its 2025 outlook to $7 to $9 a share from $11.50 to $13.50.

items.title: Medical product manufacturers are divided over Trump's tariffs
items.content: Medical technology and device makers are fighting for tariff exemptions, while PPE makers are applauding the levies.
items.contentSnippet: Medical technology and device makers are fighting for tariff exemptions, while PPE makers are applauding the levies.

items.title: CBP says latest tariffs have generated $500 million, well below Trump's estimate
items.content: Trump has repeatedly said the United States is taking in $2 billion per day from tariffs.
items.contentSnippet: Trump has repeatedly said the United States is taking in $2 billion per day from tariffs.
